Parameters: int: The check set ID, or @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#GuidedAction#NO_CHECK_SET_E@ to indicate not radio or checkbox, or @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#GuidedAction#CHECKBOX_CHECK_SET_ID_E@ to indicate a checkbox.
checkSetId(int).Description: Indicates whether this action is part of a single-select group similar to radio buttons or this action is a checkbox. When one item in a check set is checked, all others with the same check set ID will be checked automatically.

Parameters: boolean: Whether this action has a next state.
hasNext(boolean).Description: Indicates whether this action has a next state and should display a chevron.

Parameters: boolean: Whether this action is checked.
checked(boolean).Description: Indicates whether this action is initially checked.

Parameters: CharSequence: The description to edit for this action.
editDescription(java.lang.CharSequence).Description: Sets the optional description text to edit. When TextView is activated, the edit description replaces the string of description.

Parameters: boolean: Whether the action is enabled.
enabled(boolean).Description: Indicates whether this action is enabled. If not enabled, an action cannot be clicked.

Parameters: CharSequence: The title for this action.
title(java.lang.CharSequence).Description: Sets the title for this action. The title is typically a short string indicating the action to be taken on click, e.g. "Continue" or "Cancel".

Parameters: int: The resource id of title for this action.
title(int).Description: Sets the title for this action. The title is typically a short string indicating the action to be taken on click, e.g. "Continue" or "Cancel".

Parameters: int: String resource id of the optional title text to edit when TextView is activated.
editTitle(int).Description: Sets the optional title text to edit. When TextView is activated, the edit title replaces the string of title.

Parameters: int: String resource id of the description for this action.
description(int).Description: Sets the description for this action. The description is typically a longer string providing extra information on what the action will do.

Parameters: boolean: Whether this action has view can be activated to edit.
hasEditableActivatorView(boolean).Description: Indicates whether this action has a view can be activated to edit, e.g. a DatePicker.

focusable(boolean).Description: Indicates whether this action can take focus.

Parameters: Context: Context object used to build the GuidedAction.
GuidedAction.BuilderBase(android.content.Description: Creates a BuilderBase for GuidedAction or its subclass.

Parameters: boolean: True if turn on auto save/restore of GuidedAction content, false otherwise.
autoSaveRestoreEnabled(boolean).Description: Explicitly sets auto restore feature on the GuidedAction. It's by default true.

Parameters: Drawable: The drawable for the icon associated with this action.

clickAction(long).Description: Construct a clickable action with associated id and auto assign pre-defined title for the action. If the id is not supported, the method simply does nothing.

Parameters: boolean: Whether this action is editable.
editable(boolean).Description: Indicates whether this action title is editable. Note: Editable actions cannot also be checked, or belong to a check set.

Parameters: boolean: Whether this action description is editable.
descriptionEditable(boolean).Description: Indicates whether this action's description is editable

Parameters: int: The resource ID for the icon associated with this action.
icon(int).Description: Sets the action's icon drawable by retrieving it by resource ID from Builder's context. This is a convenience function that simply looks up the drawable and calls @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#GuidedAction#BuilderBase#icon_E@.

Parameters: int: The resource ID for the icon associated with this action.
Context: The context whose resource ID should be retrieved.
iconResourceId(int, android.content.Cont.Description: Use @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#GuidedAction#BuilderBase#icon_E@. Sets the action's icon drawable by retrieving it by resource ID from the specified context. This is a convenience function that simply looks up the drawable and calls @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#GuidedAction#BuilderBase#icon_E@.

Parameters: CharSequence: The description for this action.
description(java.lang.CharSequence).Description: Sets the description for this action. The description is typically a longer string providing extra information on what the action will do.

Parameters: int: InputType for the action title not in editing.
inputType(int).Description: Sets @B_android#text#InputType_E@ of this action title not in editing.

Parameters: Intent: The intent associated with this action.
intent(android.content.Intent).Description: Sets the intent associated with this action. Clients would typically fire this intent directly when the action is clicked.

Parameters: int: InputType for the action description not in editing.
descriptionInputType(int).Description: Sets @B_android#text#InputType_E@ of this action description not in editing.

Parameters: boolean: Whether this action has a next state.
infoOnly(boolean).Description: Indicates whether this action is for information purposes only and cannot be clicked.

Parameters: long: The ID to associate with this action.
id(long).Description: Sets the ID associated with this action. The ID can be any value the client wishes; it is typically used to determine what to do when an action is clicked.

Parameters: int: String resource id of the description to edit for this action.
editDescription(int).Description: Sets the optional description text to edit. When TextView is activated, the edit description replaces the string of description.

Parameters: int: InputType for the action title in editing.
editInputType(int).Description: Sets @B_android#text#InputType_E@ of this action title in editing.

Parameters: int: InputType for the action description in editing.
descriptionEditInputType(int).Description: Sets @B_android#text#InputType_E@ of this action description in editing.

Parameters: boolean: Whether this action has a multiline description.
multilineDescription(boolean).Description: Indicates whether the title and description are long, and should be displayed appropriately.

Parameters: CharSequence: The optional title text to edit when TextView is activated.
editTitle(java.lang.CharSequence).Description: Sets the optional title text to edit. When TextView is activated, the edit title replaces the string of title.

ClassDesc: Base builder class to build a @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#GuidedAction_E@ object. When subclass GuidedAction, you can override this BuilderBase class, implements your build() method which should call @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#GuidedAction#BuilderBase#applyValues_E@. When using GuidedAction directly, use @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#GuidedAction#Builder_E@.
